text:
Riverdale season two creeps ever-closer, but that hasn't stopped fans from obsessing over every trickling plot and casting detail ahead of the show's return. One in particular: the introduction of new character Toni Topaz, who reportedly gets close to Jughead while he's at Southside High — and causes a rift between him and Betty Cooper, AKA Bughead.

Bughead fandom was already intense, even before fans learned that actors Cole Sprouse and Lili Reinhart were dating in real life too. Vanessa Morgan, the actress who's playing Toni (and who's also on The Shannara Chronicles), hasn't even appeared on the show yet but is already feeling the Bughead backlash, which sometimes even comes in the form of death threats. Over a fictional couple in a fiction show.

If that seems a little much, Morgan's like, yeah me too. In an interview with Glamour, she shared:

"I’ve already had some death threats. But the thing is, it's half death threats because they don't want that [actually] happening, and there's half that's just all love. Who knows if [my character coming between Bughead] is even going to happen. People are just jumping to conclusions."

That is a pretty damn chill response to death threats, but Morgan shares that this hasn't affected her relationships with her actual cast members:

"Lili and Cole are awesome, and they have been nothing but welcoming to me. It’s great doing scenes with them. I feel lucky that everyone has been so nice. And Madelaine Petsch [who plays Cheryl Blossom] is my best friend in real life!"

With friends by her side, Morgan hopes to focus on what matters most — doing well by Toni and her bisexual representation:

"I hope the lesson is, Don't judge a book by its cover, by someone's upbringing, or by who they love. I hope people watch Toni and think, Why are we judging people? I would love that if people took that from my character."
